description: To move at a speed faster than a walk.
Scoring point in sports like soccer by getting the ball into an opponent's net.
A piece of equipment used to hit the ball in games like baseball and cricket.
To control and move a ball with short kicks or bounces.
To block a blow in fencing or martial arts.
To run a short distance at full speed.
A winter sport combining cross-country skiing and rifle shooting.
A method of restarting play in rugby by players packing closely together.
A long spear thrown in a sport to see how far it goes.
A skiing race down a winding course marked by poles.
An athlete who performs exercises requiring balance and strength.
A score of one stroke over par in golf.
A boxing punch delivered with a bent arm swinging up or around.
To bring down an opponent in football.
A swimming race where the swimmer chooses any stroke.
A diving position with legs straight and body bent at the waist.
A track and field combined event of seven contests.
A cycling race where riders follow a pacer before sprinting to the finish.
A basketball shot made close to the basket after dribbling.
To hit a ball before it touches the ground in tennis.
The horizontal bar between the goalposts in soccer and rugby.
To score by thrusting the ball down through the basket in basketball.
An unfair or illegal action in sports.
A tennis stroke played with the back of the hand facing forward.
A baseball pitch that curves as it approaches the batter.
A U-shaped ramp used in snowboarding and skateboarding.
A position in soccer that is not allowed because it gives an unfair advantage.
A punishment given for breaking the rules in sports.
The player who leads the offense in American football.
A series of boat races.
A seat for the rider of a horse or bicycle.
The stand used to hold a golf ball while driving.
A set of stumps and bails used in cricket.
A medium-sized sailboat used for racing or cruising.
